database.version: PostgreSQL 9.6.2, compiled by Visual C++ build 1800, 64-bit
database.name: OauthDB

serverOption.name: allow_system_table_mods
serverOption.short_desc: Allows modifications of the structure of system tables.

serverOption.name: application_name
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the application name to be reported in statistics and logs.

serverOption.name: archive_command
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the shell command that will be called to archive a WAL file.

serverOption.name: archive_mode
serverOption.short_desc: Allows archiving of WAL files using archive_command.

serverOption.name: archive_timeout
serverOption.short_desc: Forces a switch to the next xlog file if a new file has not been started within N seconds.

serverOption.name: array_nulls
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Enable input of NULL elements in arrays.
serverOption.extra_desc: When turned on, unquoted NULL in an array input value means a null value; otherwise it is taken literally.

serverOption.name: authentication_timeout
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum allowed time to complete client authentication.

serverOption.name: autovacuum
serverOption.short_desc: Starts the autovacuum subprocess.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor
serverOption.short_desc: Number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze as a fraction of reltuples.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_analyze_threshold
serverOption.short_desc: Minimum number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_freeze_max_age
serverOption.short_desc: Age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent transaction ID wraparound.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_max_workers
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously running autovacuum worker processes.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age
serverOption.short_desc: Multixact age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent multixact wraparound.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_naptime
serverOption.short_desc: Time to sleep between autovacuum runs.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Vacuum cost delay in milliseconds, for autovacuum.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit
serverOption.short_desc: Vacuum cost amount available before napping, for autovacuum.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor
serverOption.short_desc: Number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum as a fraction of reltuples.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_vacuum_threshold
serverOption.short_desc: Minimum number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_work_mem
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum memory to be used by each autovacuum worker process.

serverOption.name: backend_flush_after
serverOption.short_desc: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

serverOption.name: backslash_quote
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Sets whether "\'" is allowed in string literals.

serverOption.name: bgwriter_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Background writer sleep time between rounds.

serverOption.name: bgwriter_flush_after
serverOption.short_desc: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

serverOption.name: bgwriter_lru_maxpages
serverOption.short_desc: Background writer maximum number of LRU pages to flush per round.

serverOption.name: bgwriter_lru_multiplier
serverOption.short_desc: Multiple of the average buffer usage to free per round.

serverOption.name: block_size
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the size of a disk block.

serverOption.name: bonjour
serverOption.short_desc: Enables advertising the server via Bonjour.

serverOption.name: bonjour_name
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the Bonjour service name.

serverOption.name: bytea_output
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the output format for bytea.

serverOption.name: check_function_bodies
serverOption.short_desc: Check function bodies during CREATE FUNCTION.

serverOption.name: checkpoint_completion_target
serverOption.short_desc: Time spent flushing dirty buffers during checkpoint, as fraction of checkpoint interval.

serverOption.name: checkpoint_flush_after
serverOption.short_desc: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

serverOption.name: checkpoint_timeout
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum time between automatic WAL checkpoints.

serverOption.name: checkpoint_warning
serverOption.short_desc: Enables warnings if checkpoint segments are filled more frequently than this.
serverOption.extra_desc: Write a message to the server log if checkpoints caused by the filling of checkpoint segment files happens more frequently than this number of seconds. Zero turns off the warning.

serverOption.name: client_encoding
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the client's character set encoding.

serverOption.name: client_min_messages
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the message levels that are sent to the client.
serverOption.extra_desc: Each level includes all the levels that follow it. The later the level, the fewer messages are sent.

serverOption.name: cluster_name
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the name of the cluster, which is included in the process title.

serverOption.name: commit_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the delay in microseconds between transaction commit and flushing WAL to disk.

serverOption.name: commit_siblings
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the minimum concurrent open transactions before performing commit_delay.

serverOption.name: config_file
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the server's main configuration file.

serverOption.name: constraint_exclusion
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner to use constraints to optimize queries.
serverOption.extra_desc: Table scans will be skipped if their constraints guarantee that no rows match the query.

serverOption.name: cpu_index_tuple_cost
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each index entry during an index scan.

serverOption.name: cpu_operator_cost
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each operator or function call.

serverOption.name: cpu_tuple_cost
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each tuple (row).

serverOption.name: cursor_tuple_fraction
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's estimate of the fraction of a cursor's rows that will be retrieved.

serverOption.name: data_checksums
serverOption.short_desc: Shows whether data checksums are turned on for this cluster.

serverOption.name: data_directory
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the server's data directory.

serverOption.name: DateStyle
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the display format for date and time values.
serverOption.extra_desc: Also controls interpretation of ambiguous date inputs.

serverOption.name: db_user_namespace
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Enables per-database user names.

serverOption.name: deadlock_timeout
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the time to wait on a lock before checking for deadlock.

serverOption.name: debug_assertions
serverOption.short_desc: Shows whether the running server has assertion checks enabled.

serverOption.name: debug_pretty_print
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Indents parse and plan tree displays.

serverOption.name: debug_print_parse
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs each query's parse tree.

serverOption.name: debug_print_plan
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs each query's execution plan.

serverOption.name: debug_print_rewritten
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs each query's rewritten parse tree.

serverOption.name: default_statistics_target
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the default statistics target.
serverOption.extra_desc: This applies to table columns that have not had a column-specific target set via ALTER TABLE SET STATISTICS.

serverOption.name: default_tablespace
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the default tablespace to create tables and indexes in.
serverOption.extra_desc: An empty string selects the database's default tablespace.

serverOption.name: default_text_search_config
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets default text search configuration.

serverOption.name: default_transaction_deferrable
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the default deferrable status of new transactions.

serverOption.name: default_transaction_isolation
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the transaction isolation level of each new transaction.

serverOption.name: default_transaction_read_only
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the default read-only status of new transactions.

serverOption.name: default_with_oids
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Create new tables with OIDs by default.

serverOption.name: dynamic_library_path
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the path for dynamically loadable modules.
serverOption.extra_desc: If a dynamically loadable module needs to be opened and the specified name does not have a directory component (i.e., the name does not contain a slash), the system will search this path for the specified file.

serverOption.name: dynamic_shared_memory_type
serverOption.short_desc: Selects the dynamic shared memory implementation used.

serverOption.name: effective_cache_size
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's assumption about the size of the disk cache.
serverOption.extra_desc: That is, the portion of the kernel's disk cache that will be used for PostgreSQL data files. This is measured in disk pages, which are normally 8 kB each.

serverOption.name: effective_io_concurrency
serverOption.short_desc: Number of simultaneous requests that can be handled efficiently by the disk subsystem.
serverOption.extra_desc: For RAID arrays, this should be approximately the number of drive spindles in the array.

serverOption.name: enable_bitmapscan
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of bitmap-scan plans.

serverOption.name: enable_hashagg
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of hashed aggregation plans.

serverOption.name: enable_hashjoin
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of hash join plans.

serverOption.name: enable_indexonlyscan
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of index-only-scan plans.

serverOption.name: enable_indexscan
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of index-scan plans.

serverOption.name: enable_material
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of materialization.

serverOption.name: enable_mergejoin
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of merge join plans.

serverOption.name: enable_nestloop
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of nested-loop join plans.

serverOption.name: enable_seqscan
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of sequential-scan plans.

serverOption.name: enable_sort
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of explicit sort steps.

serverOption.name: enable_tidscan
serverOption.short_desc: Enables the planner's use of TID scan plans.

serverOption.name: escape_string_warning
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Warn about backslash escapes in ordinary string literals.

serverOption.name: event_source
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the application name used to identify PostgreSQL messages in the event log.

serverOption.name: exit_on_error
serverOption.short_desc: Terminate session on any error.

serverOption.name: external_pid_file
serverOption.short_desc: Writes the postmaster PID to the specified file.

serverOption.name: extra_float_digits
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the number of digits displayed for floating-point values.
serverOption.extra_desc: This affects real, double precision, and geometric data types. The parameter value is added to the standard number of digits (FLT_DIG or DBL_DIG as appropriate).

serverOption.name: force_parallel_mode
serverOption.short_desc: Forces use of parallel query facilities.
serverOption.extra_desc: If possible, run query using a parallel worker and with parallel restrictions.

serverOption.name: from_collapse_limit
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the FROM-list size beyond which subqueries are not collapsed.
serverOption.extra_desc: The planner will merge subqueries into upper queries if the resulting FROM list would have no more than this many items.

serverOption.name: fsync
serverOption.short_desc: Forces synchronization of updates to disk.
serverOption.extra_desc: The server will use the fsync() system call in several places to make sure that updates are physically written to disk. This insures that a database cluster will recover to a consistent state after an operating system or hardware crash.

serverOption.name: full_page_writes
serverOption.short_desc: Writes full pages to WAL when first modified after a checkpoint.
serverOption.extra_desc: A page write in process during an operating system crash might be only partially written to disk. During recovery, the row changes stored in WAL are not enough to recover. This option writes pages when first modified after a checkpoint to WAL so full recovery is possible.

serverOption.name: geqo
serverOption.short_desc: Enables genetic query optimization.
serverOption.extra_desc: This algorithm attempts to do planning without exhaustive searching.

serverOption.name: geqo_effort
serverOption.short_desc: GEQO: effort is used to set the default for other GEQO parameters.

serverOption.name: geqo_generations
serverOption.short_desc: GEQO: number of iterations of the algorithm.
serverOption.extra_desc: Zero selects a suitable default value.

serverOption.name: geqo_pool_size
serverOption.short_desc: GEQO: number of individuals in the population.
serverOption.extra_desc: Zero selects a suitable default value.

serverOption.name: geqo_seed
serverOption.short_desc: GEQO: seed for random path selection.

serverOption.name: geqo_selection_bias
serverOption.short_desc: GEQO: selective pressure within the population.

serverOption.name: geqo_threshold
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the threshold of FROM items beyond which GEQO is used.

serverOption.name: gin_fuzzy_search_limit
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum allowed result for exact search by GIN.

serverOption.name: gin_pending_list_limit
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum size of the pending list for GIN index.

serverOption.name: hba_file
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the server's "hba" configuration file.

serverOption.name: hot_standby
serverOption.short_desc: Allows connections and queries during recovery.

serverOption.name: hot_standby_feedback
serverOption.short_desc: Allows feedback from a hot standby to the primary that will avoid query conflicts.

serverOption.name: huge_pages
serverOption.short_desc: Use of huge pages on Linux.

serverOption.name: ident_file
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the server's "ident" configuration file.

serverOption.name: idle_in_transaction_session_timeout
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum allowed duration of any idling transaction.
serverOption.extra_desc: A value of 0 turns off the timeout.

serverOption.name: ignore_checksum_failure
serverOption.short_desc: Continues processing after a checksum failure.
serverOption.extra_desc: Detection of a checksum failure normally causes PostgreSQL to report an error, aborting the current transaction. Setting ignore_checksum_failure to true causes the system to ignore the failure (but still report a warning), and continue processing. This behavior could cause crashes or other serious problems. Only has an effect if checksums are enabled.

serverOption.name: ignore_system_indexes
serverOption.short_desc: Disables reading from system indexes.
serverOption.extra_desc: It does not prevent updating the indexes, so it is safe to use. The worst consequence is slowness.

serverOption.name: integer_datetimes
serverOption.short_desc: Datetimes are integer based.

serverOption.name: IntervalStyle
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the display format for interval values.

serverOption.name: join_collapse_limit
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the FROM-list size beyond which JOIN constructs are not flattened.
serverOption.extra_desc: The planner will flatten explicit JOIN constructs into lists of FROM items whenever a list of no more than this many items would result.

serverOption.name: krb_caseins_users
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Sets whether Kerberos and GSSAPI user names should be treated as case-insensitive.

serverOption.name: krb_server_keyfile
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the location of the Kerberos server key file.

serverOption.name: lc_collate
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the collation order locale.

serverOption.name: lc_ctype
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the character classification and case conversion locale.

serverOption.name: lc_messages
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the language in which messages are displayed.

serverOption.name: lc_monetary
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the locale for formatting monetary amounts.

serverOption.name: lc_numeric
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the locale for formatting numbers.

serverOption.name: lc_time
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the locale for formatting date and time values.

serverOption.name: listen_addresses
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the host name or IP address(es) to listen to.

serverOption.name: lo_compat_privileges
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Enables backward compatibility mode for privilege checks on large objects.
serverOption.extra_desc: Skips privilege checks when reading or modifying large objects, for compatibility with PostgreSQL releases prior to 9.0.

serverOption.name: local_preload_libraries
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Shared Library Preloading
serverOption.short_desc: Lists unprivileged shared libraries to preload into each backend.

serverOption.name: lock_timeout
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum allowed duration of any wait for a lock.
serverOption.extra_desc: A value of 0 turns off the timeout.

serverOption.name: log_autovacuum_min_duration
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the minimum execution time above which autovacuum actions will be logged.
serverOption.extra_desc: Zero prints all actions. -1 turns autovacuum logging off.

serverOption.name: log_checkpoints
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs each checkpoint.

serverOption.name: log_connections
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs each successful connection.

serverOption.name: log_destination
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the destination for server log output.
serverOption.extra_desc: Valid values are combinations of "stderr", "syslog", "csvlog", and "eventlog", depending on the platform.

serverOption.name: log_directory
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the destination directory for log files.
serverOption.extra_desc: Can be specified as relative to the data directory or as absolute path.

serverOption.name: log_disconnections
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs end of a session, including duration.

serverOption.name: log_duration
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs the duration of each completed SQL statement.

serverOption.name: log_error_verbosity
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the verbosity of logged messages.

serverOption.name: log_executor_stats
serverOption.short_desc: Writes executor performance statistics to the server log.

serverOption.name: log_file_mode
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the file permissions for log files.
serverOption.extra_desc: The parameter value is expected to be a numeric mode specification in the form accepted by the chmod and umask system calls. (To use the customary octal format the number must start with a 0 (zero).)

serverOption.name: log_filename
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the file name pattern for log files.

serverOption.name: log_hostname
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs the host name in the connection logs.
serverOption.extra_desc: By default, connection logs only show the IP address of the connecting host. If you want them to show the host name you can turn this on, but depending on your host name resolution setup it might impose a non-negligible performance penalty.

serverOption.name: log_line_prefix
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Controls information prefixed to each log line.
serverOption.extra_desc: If blank, no prefix is used.

serverOption.name: log_lock_waits
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs long lock waits.

serverOption.name: log_min_duration_statement
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the minimum execution time above which statements will be logged.
serverOption.extra_desc: Zero prints all queries. -1 turns this feature off.

serverOption.name: log_min_error_statement
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Causes all statements generating error at or above this level to be logged.
serverOption.extra_desc: Each level includes all the levels that follow it. The later the level, the fewer messages are sent.

serverOption.name: log_min_messages
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / When to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the message levels that are logged.
serverOption.extra_desc: Each level includes all the levels that follow it. The later the level, the fewer messages are sent.

serverOption.name: log_parser_stats
serverOption.short_desc: Writes parser performance statistics to the server log.

serverOption.name: log_planner_stats
serverOption.short_desc: Writes planner performance statistics to the server log.

serverOption.name: log_replication_commands
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Logs each replication command.

serverOption.name: log_rotation_age
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Automatic log file rotation will occur after N minutes.

serverOption.name: log_rotation_size
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Automatic log file rotation will occur after N kilobytes.

serverOption.name: log_statement
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the type of statements logged.

serverOption.name: log_statement_stats
serverOption.short_desc: Writes cumulative performance statistics to the server log.

serverOption.name: log_temp_files
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Log the use of temporary files larger than this number of kilobytes.
serverOption.extra_desc: Zero logs all files. The default is -1 (turning this feature off).

serverOption.name: log_timezone
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / What to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the time zone to use in log messages.

serverOption.name: log_truncate_on_rotation
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Truncate existing log files of same name during log rotation.

serverOption.name: logging_collector
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Start a subprocess to capture stderr output and/or csvlogs into log files.

serverOption.name: maintenance_work_mem
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum memory to be used for maintenance operations.
serverOption.extra_desc: This includes operations such as VACUUM and CREATE INDEX.

serverOption.name: max_connections
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of concurrent connections.

serverOption.name: max_files_per_process
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously open files for each server process.

serverOption.name: max_function_args
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the maximum number of function arguments.

serverOption.name: max_identifier_length
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the maximum identifier length.

serverOption.name: max_index_keys
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the maximum number of index keys.

serverOption.name: max_locks_per_transaction
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of locks per transaction.
serverOption.extra_desc: The shared lock table is sized on the assumption that at most max_locks_per_transaction * max_connections distinct objects will need to be locked at any one time.

serverOption.name: max_parallel_workers_per_gather
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of parallel processes per executor node.

serverOption.name: max_pred_locks_per_transaction
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of predicate locks per transaction.
serverOption.extra_desc: The shared predicate lock table is sized on the assumption that at most max_pred_locks_per_transaction * max_connections distinct objects will need to be locked at any one time.

serverOption.name: max_prepared_transactions
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously prepared transactions.

serverOption.name: max_replication_slots
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously defined replication slots.

serverOption.name: max_stack_depth
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum stack depth, in kilobytes.

serverOption.name: max_standby_archive_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum delay before canceling queries when a hot standby server is processing archived WAL data.

serverOption.name: max_standby_streaming_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum delay before canceling queries when a hot standby server is processing streamed WAL data.

serverOption.name: max_wal_senders
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously running WAL sender processes.

serverOption.name: max_wal_size
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the WAL size that triggers a checkpoint.

serverOption.name: max_worker_processes
serverOption.short_desc: Maximum number of concurrent worker processes.

serverOption.name: min_parallel_relation_size
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the minimum size of relations to be considered for parallel scan.

serverOption.name: min_wal_size
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the minimum size to shrink the WAL to.

serverOption.name: old_snapshot_threshold
serverOption.short_desc: Time before a snapshot is too old to read pages changed after the snapshot was taken.
serverOption.extra_desc: A value of -1 disables this feature.

serverOption.name: operator_precedence_warning
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Emit a warning for constructs that changed meaning since PostgreSQL 9.4.

serverOption.name: parallel_setup_cost
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of starting up worker processes for parallel query.

serverOption.name: parallel_tuple_cost
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of passing each tuple (row) from worker to master backend.

serverOption.name: password_encryption
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Encrypt passwords.
serverOption.extra_desc: When a password is specified in CREATE USER or ALTER USER without writing either ENCRYPTED or UNENCRYPTED, this parameter determines whether the password is to be encrypted.

serverOption.name: port
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the TCP port the server listens on.

serverOption.name: post_auth_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Waits N seconds on connection startup after authentication.
serverOption.extra_desc: This allows attaching a debugger to the process.

serverOption.name: pre_auth_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Waits N seconds on connection startup before authentication.
serverOption.extra_desc: This allows attaching a debugger to the process.

serverOption.name: quote_all_identifiers
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: When generating SQL fragments, quote all identifiers.

serverOption.name: random_page_cost
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of a nonsequentially fetched disk page.

serverOption.name: replacement_sort_tuples
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of tuples to be sorted using replacement selection.
serverOption.extra_desc: When more tuples than this are present, quicksort will be used.

serverOption.name: restart_after_crash
serverOption.short_desc: Reinitialize server after backend crash.

serverOption.name: row_security
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Enable row security.
serverOption.extra_desc: When enabled, row security will be applied to all users.

serverOption.name: search_path
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the schema search order for names that are not schema-qualified.

serverOption.name: segment_size
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the number of pages per disk file.

serverOption.name: seq_page_cost
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of a sequentially fetched disk page.

serverOption.name: server_encoding
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the server (database) character set encoding.

serverOption.name: server_version
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the server version.

serverOption.name: server_version_num
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the server version as an integer.

serverOption.name: session_preload_libraries
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Shared Library Preloading
serverOption.short_desc: Lists shared libraries to preload into each backend.

serverOption.name: session_replication_role
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the session's behavior for triggers and rewrite rules.

serverOption.name: shared_buffers
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the number of shared memory buffers used by the server.

serverOption.name: shared_preload_libraries
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Shared Library Preloading
serverOption.short_desc: Lists shared libraries to preload into server.

serverOption.name: sql_inheritance
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Causes subtables to be included by default in various commands.

serverOption.name: ssl
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Enables SSL connections.

serverOption.name: ssl_ca_file
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Location of the SSL certificate authority file.

serverOption.name: ssl_cert_file
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Location of the SSL server certificate file.

serverOption.name: ssl_ciphers
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the list of allowed SSL ciphers.

serverOption.name: ssl_crl_file
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Location of the SSL certificate revocation list file.

serverOption.name: ssl_ecdh_curve
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the curve to use for ECDH.

serverOption.name: ssl_key_file
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Location of the SSL server private key file.

serverOption.name: ssl_prefer_server_ciphers
serverOption.category: Connections and Authentication / Security and Authentication
serverOption.short_desc: Give priority to server ciphersuite order.

serverOption.name: standard_conforming_strings
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Causes '...' strings to treat backslashes literally.

serverOption.name: statement_timeout
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum allowed duration of any statement.
serverOption.extra_desc: A value of 0 turns off the timeout.

serverOption.name: stats_temp_directory
serverOption.category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector
serverOption.short_desc: Writes temporary statistics files to the specified directory.

serverOption.name: superuser_reserved_connections
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the number of connection slots reserved for superusers.

serverOption.name: synchronize_seqscans
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Previous PostgreSQL Versions
serverOption.short_desc: Enable synchronized sequential scans.

serverOption.name: synchronous_commit
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the current transaction's synchronization level.

serverOption.name: synchronous_standby_names
serverOption.short_desc: Number of synchronous standbys and list of names of potential synchronous ones.

serverOption.name: syslog_facility
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the syslog "facility" to be used when syslog enabled.

serverOption.name: syslog_ident
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the program name used to identify PostgreSQL messages in syslog.

serverOption.name: syslog_sequence_numbers
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Add sequence number to syslog messages to avoid duplicate suppression.

serverOption.name: syslog_split_messages
serverOption.category: Reporting and Logging / Where to Log
serverOption.short_desc: Split messages sent to syslog by lines and to fit into 1024 bytes.

serverOption.name: tcp_keepalives_count
serverOption.short_desc: Maximum number of TCP keepalive retransmits.
serverOption.extra_desc: This controls the number of consecutive keepalive retransmits that can be lost before a connection is considered dead. A value of 0 uses the system default.

serverOption.name: tcp_keepalives_idle
serverOption.short_desc: Time between issuing TCP keepalives.
serverOption.extra_desc: A value of 0 uses the system default.

serverOption.name: tcp_keepalives_interval
serverOption.short_desc: Time between TCP keepalive retransmits.
serverOption.extra_desc: A value of 0 uses the system default.

serverOption.name: temp_buffers
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of temporary buffers used by each session.

serverOption.name: temp_file_limit
serverOption.short_desc: Limits the total size of all temporary files used by each process.
serverOption.extra_desc: -1 means no limit.

serverOption.name: temp_tablespaces
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the tablespace(s) to use for temporary tables and sort files.

serverOption.name: TimeZone
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the time zone for displaying and interpreting time stamps.

serverOption.name: timezone_abbreviations
serverOption.category: Client Connection Defaults / Locale and Formatting
serverOption.short_desc: Selects a file of time zone abbreviations.

serverOption.name: trace_notify
serverOption.short_desc: Generates debugging output for LISTEN and NOTIFY.

serverOption.name: trace_recovery_messages
serverOption.short_desc: Enables logging of recovery-related debugging information.
serverOption.extra_desc: Each level includes all the levels that follow it. The later the level, the fewer messages are sent.

serverOption.name: trace_sort
serverOption.short_desc: Emit information about resource usage in sorting.

serverOption.name: track_activities
serverOption.category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector
serverOption.short_desc: Collects information about executing commands.
serverOption.extra_desc: Enables the collection of information on the currently executing command of each session, along with the time at which that command began execution.

serverOption.name: track_activity_query_size
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the size reserved for pg_stat_activity.query, in bytes.

serverOption.name: track_commit_timestamp
serverOption.short_desc: Collects transaction commit time.

serverOption.name: track_counts
serverOption.category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector
serverOption.short_desc: Collects statistics on database activity.

serverOption.name: track_functions
serverOption.category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector
serverOption.short_desc: Collects function-level statistics on database activity.

serverOption.name: track_io_timing
serverOption.category: Statistics / Query and Index Statistics Collector
serverOption.short_desc: Collects timing statistics for database I/O activity.

serverOption.name: transaction_deferrable
serverOption.short_desc: Whether to defer a read-only serializable transaction until it can be executed with no possible serialization failures.

serverOption.name: transaction_isolation
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the current transaction's isolation level.

serverOption.name: transaction_read_only
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the current transaction's read-only status.

serverOption.name: transform_null_equals
serverOption.category: Version and Platform Compatibility / Other Platforms and Clients
serverOption.short_desc: Treats "expr=NULL" as "expr IS NULL".
serverOption.extra_desc: When turned on, expressions of the form expr = NULL (or NULL = expr) are treated as expr IS NULL, that is, they return true if expr evaluates to the null value, and false otherwise. The correct behavior of expr = NULL is to always return null (unknown).

serverOption.name: unix_socket_directories
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the directories where Unix-domain sockets will be created.

serverOption.name: unix_socket_group
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the owning group of the Unix-domain socket.
serverOption.extra_desc: The owning user of the socket is always the user that starts the server.

serverOption.name: unix_socket_permissions
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the access permissions of the Unix-domain socket.
serverOption.extra_desc: Unix-domain sockets use the usual Unix file system permission set. The parameter value is expected to be a numeric mode specification in the form accepted by the chmod and umask system calls. (To use the customary octal format the number must start with a 0 (zero).)

serverOption.name: update_process_title
serverOption.short_desc: Updates the process title to show the active SQL command.
serverOption.extra_desc: Enables updating of the process title every time a new SQL command is received by the server.

serverOption.name: vacuum_cost_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Vacuum cost delay in milliseconds.

serverOption.name: vacuum_cost_limit
serverOption.short_desc: Vacuum cost amount available before napping.

serverOption.name: vacuum_cost_page_dirty
serverOption.short_desc: Vacuum cost for a page dirtied by vacuum.

serverOption.name: vacuum_cost_page_hit
serverOption.short_desc: Vacuum cost for a page found in the buffer cache.

serverOption.name: vacuum_cost_page_miss
serverOption.short_desc: Vacuum cost for a page not found in the buffer cache.

serverOption.name: vacuum_defer_cleanup_age
serverOption.short_desc: Number of transactions by which VACUUM and HOT cleanup should be deferred, if any.

serverOption.name: vacuum_freeze_min_age
serverOption.short_desc: Minimum age at which VACUUM should freeze a table row.

serverOption.name: vacuum_freeze_table_age
serverOption.short_desc: Age at which VACUUM should scan whole table to freeze tuples.

serverOption.name: vacuum_multixact_freeze_min_age
serverOption.short_desc: Minimum age at which VACUUM should freeze a MultiXactId in a table row.

serverOption.name: vacuum_multixact_freeze_table_age
serverOption.short_desc: Multixact age at which VACUUM should scan whole table to freeze tuples.

serverOption.name: wal_block_size
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the block size in the write ahead log.

serverOption.name: wal_buffers
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the number of disk-page buffers in shared memory for WAL.

serverOption.name: wal_compression
serverOption.short_desc: Compresses full-page writes written in WAL file.

serverOption.name: wal_keep_segments
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the number of WAL files held for standby servers.

serverOption.name: wal_level
serverOption.short_desc: Set the level of information written to the WAL.

serverOption.name: wal_log_hints
serverOption.short_desc: Writes full pages to WAL when first modified after a checkpoint, even for a non-critical modifications.

serverOption.name: wal_receiver_status_interval
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum interval between WAL receiver status reports to the primary.

serverOption.name: wal_receiver_timeout
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum wait time to receive data from the primary.

serverOption.name: wal_retrieve_retry_interval
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the time to wait before retrying to retrieve WAL after a failed attempt.

serverOption.name: wal_segment_size
serverOption.short_desc: Shows the number of pages per write ahead log segment.

serverOption.name: wal_sender_timeout
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum time to wait for WAL replication.

serverOption.name: wal_sync_method
serverOption.short_desc: Selects the method used for forcing WAL updates to disk.

serverOption.name: wal_writer_delay
serverOption.short_desc: Time between WAL flushes performed in the WAL writer.

serverOption.name: wal_writer_flush_after
serverOption.short_desc: Amount of WAL written out by WAL writer that triggers a flush.

serverOption.name: work_mem
serverOption.short_desc: Sets the maximum memory to be used for query workspaces.
serverOption.extra_desc: This much memory can be used by each internal sort operation and hash table before switching to temporary disk files.

serverOption.name: xmlbinary
serverOption.short_desc: Sets how binary values are to be encoded in XML.

serverOption.name: xmloption
serverOption.short_desc: Sets whether XML data in implicit parsing and serialization operations is to be considered as documents or content fragments.

serverOption.name: zero_damaged_pages
serverOption.short_desc: Continues processing past damaged page headers.
serverOption.extra_desc: Detection of a damaged page header normally causes PostgreSQL to report an error, aborting the current transaction. Setting zero_damaged_pages to true causes the system to instead report a warning, zero out the damaged page, and continue processing. This behavior will destroy data, namely all the rows on the damaged page.

serverOption.name: allow_system_table_mods
serverOption.description: Allows modifications of the structure of system tables.

serverOption.name: application_name
serverOption.description: Sets the application name to be reported in statistics and logs.

serverOption.name: archive_command
serverOption.description: Sets the shell command that will be called to archive a WAL file.

serverOption.name: archive_mode
serverOption.description: Allows archiving of WAL files using archive_command.

serverOption.name: archive_timeout
serverOption.description: Forces a switch to the next xlog file if a new file has not been started within N seconds.

serverOption.name: array_nulls
serverOption.description: Enable input of NULL elements in arrays.

serverOption.name: authentication_timeout
serverOption.description: Sets the maximum allowed time to complete client authentication.

serverOption.name: autovacuum
serverOption.description: Starts the autovacuum subprocess.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor
serverOption.description: Number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze as a fraction of reltuples.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_analyze_threshold
serverOption.description: Minimum number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_freeze_max_age
serverOption.description: Age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent transaction ID wraparound.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_max_workers
serverOption.description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously running autovacuum worker processes.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age
serverOption.description: Multixact age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent multixact wraparound.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_naptime
serverOption.description: Time to sleep between autovacuum runs.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay
serverOption.description: Vacuum cost delay in milliseconds, for autovacuum.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit
serverOption.description: Vacuum cost amount available before napping, for autovacuum.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor
serverOption.description: Number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum as a fraction of reltuples.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_vacuum_threshold
serverOption.description: Minimum number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum.

serverOption.name: autovacuum_work_mem
serverOption.description: Sets the maximum memory to be used by each autovacuum worker process.

serverOption.name: backend_flush_after
serverOption.description: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

serverOption.name: backslash_quote
serverOption.description: Sets whether "\'" is allowed in string literals.

serverOption.name: bgwriter_delay
serverOption.description: Background writer sleep time between rounds.

serverOption.name: bgwriter_flush_after
serverOption.description: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

serverOption.name: bgwriter_lru_maxpages
serverOption.description: Background writer maximum number of LRU pages to flush per round.

serverOption.name: bgwriter_lru_multiplier
serverOption.description: Multiple of the average buffer usage to free per round.

serverOption.name: block_size
serverOption.description: Shows the size of a disk block.

serverOption.name: bonjour
serverOption.description: Enables advertising the server via Bonjour.

serverOption.name: bonjour_name
serverOption.description: Sets the Bonjour service name.

serverOption.name: bytea_output
serverOption.description: Sets the output format for bytea.

serverOption.name: check_function_bodies
serverOption.description: Check function bodies during CREATE FUNCTION.

serverOption.name: checkpoint_completion_target
serverOption.description: Time spent flushing dirty buffers during checkpoint, as fraction of checkpoint interval.

serverOption.name: checkpoint_flush_after
serverOption.description: Number of pages after which previously performed writes are flushed to disk.

serverOption.name: checkpoint_timeout
serverOption.description: Sets the maximum time between automatic WAL checkpoints.

serverOption.name: checkpoint_warning
serverOption.description: Enables warnings if checkpoint segments are filled more frequently than this.

serverOption.name: client_encoding
serverOption.description: Sets the client's character set encoding.

serverOption.name: client_min_messages
serverOption.description: Sets the message levels that are sent to the client.

serverOption.name: cluster_name
serverOption.description: Sets the name of the cluster, which is included in the process title.

serverOption.name: commit_delay
serverOption.description: Sets the delay in microseconds between transaction commit and flushing WAL to disk.

serverOption.name: commit_siblings
serverOption.description: Sets the minimum concurrent open transactions before performing commit_delay.

serverOption.name: config_file
serverOption.description: Sets the server's main configuration file.

serverOption.name: constraint_exclusion
serverOption.description: Enables the planner to use constraints to optimize queries.

serverOption.name: cpu_index_tuple_cost
serverOption.description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each index entry during an index scan.

serverOption.name: cpu_operator_cost
serverOption.description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each operator or function call.

serverOption.name: cpu_tuple_cost
serverOption.description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each tuple (row).

serverOption.name: cursor_tuple_fraction
serverOption.description: Sets the planner's estimate of the fraction of a cursor's rows that will be retrieved.

serverOption.name: data_checksums
serverOption.description: Shows whether data checksums are turned on for this cluster.

serverOption.name: data_directory
serverOption.description: Sets the server's data directory.

serverOption.name: DateStyle
serverOption.description: Sets the display format for date and time values.

serverOption.name: db_user_namespace
serverOption.description: Enables per-database user names.

serverOption.name: deadlock_timeout
serverOption.description: Sets the time to wait on a lock before checking for deadlock.

serverOption.name: debug_assertions
serverOption.description: Shows whether the running server has assertion checks enabled.

serverOption.name: debug_pretty_print
serverOption.description: Indents parse and plan tree displays.

serverOption.name: debug_print_parse
serverOption.description: Logs each query's parse tree.

serverOption.name: debug_print_plan
serverOption.description: Logs each query's execution plan.

serverOption.name: debug_print_rewritten
serverOption.description: Logs each query's rewritten parse tree.

serverOption.name: default_statistics_target
serverOption.description: Sets the default statistics target.

serverOption.name: default_tablespace
serverOption.description: Sets the default tablespace to create tables and indexes in.

serverOption.name: default_text_search_config
serverOption.description: Sets default text search configuration.

serverOption.name: default_transaction_deferrable
serverOption.description: Sets the default deferrable status of new transactions.

serverOption.name: default_transaction_isolation
serverOption.description: Sets the transaction isolation level of each new transaction.

serverOption.name: default_transaction_read_only
serverOption.description: Sets the default read-only status of new transactions.

serverOption.name: default_with_oids
serverOption.description: Create new tables with OIDs by default.

serverOption.name: dynamic_library_path
serverOption.description: Sets the path for dynamically loadable modules.

serverOption.name: dynamic_shared_memory_type
serverOption.description: Selects the dynamic shared memory implementation used.

serverOption.name: effective_cache_size
serverOption.description: Sets the planner's assumption about the size of the disk cache.

serverOption.name: effective_io_concurrency
serverOption.description: Number of simultaneous requests that can be handled efficiently by the disk subsystem.

serverOption.name: enable_bitmapscan
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of bitmap-scan plans.

serverOption.name: enable_hashagg
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of hashed aggregation plans.

serverOption.name: enable_hashjoin
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of hash join plans.

serverOption.name: enable_indexonlyscan
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of index-only-scan plans.

serverOption.name: enable_indexscan
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of index-scan plans.

serverOption.name: enable_material
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of materialization.

serverOption.name: enable_mergejoin
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of merge join plans.

serverOption.name: enable_nestloop
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of nested-loop join plans.

serverOption.name: enable_seqscan
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of sequential-scan plans.

serverOption.name: enable_sort
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of explicit sort steps.

serverOption.name: enable_tidscan
serverOption.description: Enables the planner's use of TID scan plans.

serverOption.name: escape_string_warning
serverOption.description: Warn about backslash escapes in ordinary string literals.

serverOption.name: event_source
serverOption.description: Sets the application name used to identify PostgreSQL messages in the event log.

serverOption.name: exit_on_error
serverOption.description: Terminate session on any error.

serverOption.name: external_pid_file
serverOption.description: Writes the postmaster PID to the specified file.

serverOption.name: extra_float_digits
serverOption.description: Sets the number of digits displayed for floating-point values.

serverOption.name: force_parallel_mode
serverOption.description: Forces use of parallel query facilities.

serverOption.name: from_collapse_limit
serverOption.description: Sets the FROM-list size beyond which subqueries are not collapsed.

serverOption.name: fsync
serverOption.description: Forces synchronization of updates to disk.

serverOption.name: full_page_writes
serverOption.description: Writes full pages to WAL when first modified after a checkpoint.

serverOption.name: geqo
serverOption.description: Enables genetic query optimization.

serverOption.name: geqo_effort
serverOption.description: GEQO: effort is used to set the default for other GEQO parameters.

serverOption.name: geqo_generations
serverOption.description: GEQO: number of iterations of the algorithm.

serverOption.name: geqo_pool_size
serverOption.description: GEQO: number of individuals in the population.

serverOption.name: geqo_seed
serverOption.description: GEQO: seed for random path selection.

serverOption.name: geqo_selection_bias
serverOption.description: GEQO: selective pressure within the population.

serverOption.name: geqo_threshold
serverOption.description: Sets the threshold of FROM items beyond which GEQO is used.

serverOption.name: gin_fuzzy_search_limit
serverOption.description: Sets the maximum allowed result for exact search by GIN.

serverOption.name: gin_pending_list_limit
serverOption.description: Sets the maximum size of the pending list for GIN index.

serverOption.name: hba_file
serverOption.description: Sets the server's "hba" configuration file.

serverOption.name: hot_standby
serverOption.description: Allows connections and queries during recovery.

serverOption.name: hot_standby_feedback
serverOption.description: Allows feedback from a hot standby to the primary that will avoid query conflicts.

serverOption.name: huge_pages
serverOption.description: Use of huge pages on Linux.

serverOption.name: ident_file
serverOption.description: Sets the server's "ident" configuration file.

serverOption.name: idle_in_transaction_session_timeout
serverOption.description: Sets the maximum allowed duration of any idling transaction.

serverOption.name: ignore_checksum_failure
serverOption.description: Continues processing after a checksum failure.

serverOption.name: ignore_system_indexes
serverOption.description: Disables reading from system indexes.

serverOption.name: integer_datetimes
serverOption.description: Datetimes are integer based.

serverOption.name: IntervalStyle
serverOption.description: Sets the display format for interval values.

serverOption.name: join_collapse_limit
serverOption.description: Sets the FROM-list size beyond which JOIN constructs are not flattened.

serverOption.name: krb_caseins_users
serverOption.description: Sets whether Kerberos and GSSAPI user names should be treated as case-insensitive.

serverOption.name: krb_server_keyfile
serverOption.description: Sets the location of the Kerberos server key file.

serverOption.name: lc_collate
serverOption.description: Shows the collation order locale.

serverOption.name: lc_ctype
serverOption.description: Shows the character classification and case conversion locale.

serverOption.name: lc_messages
serverOption.description: Sets the language in which messages are displayed.

serverOption.name: lc_monetary
serverOption.description: Sets the locale for formatting monetary amounts.

serverOption.name: lc_numeric
serverOption.description: Sets the locale for formatting numbers.

serverOption.name: lc_time
serverOption.description: Sets the locale for formatting date and time values.

serverOption.name: listen_addresses
serverOption.description: Sets the host name or IP address(es) to listen to.

serverOption.name: lo_compat_privileges
serverOption.description: Enables backward compatibility mode for privilege checks on large objects.

serverOption.name: local_preload_libraries
serverOption.description: Lists unprivileged shared libraries to preload into each backend.

serverOption.name: lock_timeout
serverOption.description: Sets the maximum allowed duration of any wait for a lock.

serverOption.name: log_autovacuum_min_duration
serverOption.description: Sets the minimum execution time above which autovacuum actions will be logged.

serverOption.name: log_checkpoints
serverOption.description: Logs each checkpoint.

serverOption.name: log_connections
serverOption.description: Logs each successful connection.

serverOption.name: log_destination
serverOption.description: Sets the destination for server log output.

serverOption.name: log_directory
serverOption.description: Sets the destination directory for log files.

serverOption.name: log_disconnections
serverOption.description: Logs end of a session, including duration.

serverOption.name: log_duration
serverOption.description: Logs the duration of each completed SQL statement.

serverOption.name: log_error_verbosity
serverOption.description: Sets the verbosity of logged messages.

serverOption.name: log_executor_stats
serverOption.description: Writes executor performance statistics to the server log.

serverOption.name: log_file_mode
serverOption.description: Sets the file permissions for log files.

serverOption.name: log_filename
serverOption.description: Sets the file name pattern for log files.

serverOption.name: log_hostname
serverOption.description: Logs the host name in the connection logs.

serverOption.name: log_line_prefix
serverOption.description: Controls information prefixed to each log line.

serverOption.name: log_lock_waits
serverOption.description: Logs long lock waits.

serverOption.name: log_min_duration_statement
serverOption.description: Sets the minimum execution time above which statements will be logged.

serverOption.name: log_min_error_statement
serverOption.description: Causes all statements generating error at or above this level to be logged.

serverOption.name: log_min_messages
serverOption.description: Sets the message levels that are logged.

serverOption.name: log_parser_stats
serverOption.description: Writes parser performance statistics to the server log.

serverOption.name: log_planner_stats
serverOption.description: Writes planner performance statistics to the server log.

serverOption.name: log_replication_commands
serverOption.description: Logs each replication command.

serverOption.name: log_rotation_age
serverOption.description: Automatic log file rotation will occur after N minutes.

serverOption.name: log_rotation_size
serverOption.description: Automatic log file rotation will occur after N kilobytes.

serverOption.name: log_statement
serverOption.description: Sets the type of statements logged.

serverOption.name: log_statement_stats
serverOption.description: Writes cumulative performance statistics to the server log.

serverOption.name: log_temp_files
serverOption.description: Log the use of temporary files larger than this number of kilobytes.

serverOption.name: log_timezone
serverOption.description: Sets the time zone to use in log messages.

serverOption.name: log_truncate_on_rotation
serverOption.description: Truncate existing log files of same name during log rotation.

serverOption.name: logging_collector
serverOption.description: Start a subprocess to capture stderr output and/or csvlogs into log files.

serverOption.name: maintenance_work_mem

serverOption.name: max_stack_depth

serverOption.name: seq_page_cost

serverOption.name: server_version_num

serverOption.name: shared_preload_libraries

serverOption.name: transform_null_equals

serverOption.name: update_process_title

table.name: public.accesstokens
table.code: CREATE TABLE accesstokens ( accesstokenid integer NOT NULL, accesstoken character varying(256), expires timestamp without time zone NOT NULL, scopeid integer, clientid integer NOT NULL, userid integer NOT NULL, createdat timestamp without time zone NOT NULL )

table.name: public.authorizationcodes
table.code: CREATE TABLE authorizationcodes ( authorizationcodeid integer NOT NULL, authorizationcode character varying(256) NOT NULL, expires timestamp without time zone NOT NULL, scopeid integer, redirecturi character varying(4000), clientid integer, userid integer NOT NULL, createdat timestamp without time zone NOT NULL )

table.name: public.clients
table.code: CREATE TABLE clients ( clientid integer NOT NULL, clientuuid uuid NOT NULL, clientname character varying(256), clientsecret character varying(80), redirecturis text[], grants text[], scopeid integer, userid integer NOT NULL, createdat timestamp without time zone NOT NULL )

table.name: public.logstatus
table.code: CREATE TABLE logstatus ( logstatusid integer NOT NULL, logstatus character varying(50), logstatusdescription character varying(250) )

table.name: public.logtable
table.code: CREATE TABLE logtable ( logid integer NOT NULL, logstatusid integer NOT NULL, logmessage character varying(4000) NOT NULL, logobjectname character varying(250), parameters character varying(4000), createdat timestamp without time zone NOT NULL )

table.name: public.patches
table.code: CREATE TABLE patches ( patchname character varying, patchnumber integer, patchdescription character varying, startat timestamp without time zone, endat timestamp without time zone, status character varying )

table.name: public.refreshtokens
table.code: CREATE TABLE refreshtokens ( refreshtokenid integer NOT NULL, refreshtoken character varying(256) NOT NULL, expires timestamp without time zone, scopeid integer, clientid integer NOT NULL, userid integer NOT NULL, createdat timestamp without time zone NOT NULL )

table.name: public.roles
table.code: CREATE TABLE roles ( roleid integer NOT NULL, roleuuid uuid NOT NULL, rolename character varying(250) NOT NULL, roledescription character varying(4000) )

table.name: public.scopes
table.code: CREATE TABLE scopes ( scopeid integer NOT NULL, scopeuuid uuid, isdefault boolean, parameters character varying(4000), description character varying(4000), createdat timestamp without time zone NOT NULL )

table.name: public.scopesroles
table.code: CREATE TABLE scopesroles ( scopeid integer NOT NULL, roleid integer NOT NULL )

table.name: public.users
table.code: CREATE TABLE users ( userid integer NOT NULL, externalid character varying(4000), useruuid uuid NOT NULL, username character varying(250) NOT NULL, userpwd character varying, firstname character varying(250), lastname character varying, useremail character varying(2000), oauth2provider character varying(250), createdat timestamp without time zone, updatedat timestamp without time zone, imgpath character varying(1000), thumbnail bytea )

table.name: public.usersroles
table.code: CREATE TABLE usersroles ( userid integer NOT NULL, roleid integer NOT NULL )

public.getaccesstoken
procedure.routine_definition: select at.accesstoken, at.expires at time zone 'utc', sc.scopeuuid, cl.clientuuid, us.useruuid, at.createdat at time zone 'utc' from accesstokens at join clients cl on at.clientid = cl.clientid join users us on at.userid = us.userid left outer join scopes sc on at.scopeid = sc.scopeid where at.accesstoken = vaccesstoken;
procedure.code: CREATE FUNCTION getaccesstoken(vaccesstoken character varying) RETURNS TABLE("accessToken" character varying, "accessTokenExpiresAt" timestamp with time zone, scope uuid, client uuid, "user" uuid, createdat timestamp with time zone) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ select at.accesstoken, at.expires at time zone 'utc', sc.scopeuuid, cl.clientuuid, us.useruuid, at.createdat at time zone 'utc' from accesstokens at join clients cl on at.clientid = cl.clientid join users us on at.userid = us.userid left outer join scopes sc on at.scopeid = sc.scopeid where at.accesstoken = vaccesstoken; $$;

procedure.name: public.getauthorizationcode
procedure.routine_definition: select ac.authorizationcode, ac.expires at time zone 'utc', sc.scopeuuid, ac.redirecturi, cl.clientuuid, us.useruuid, ac.createdat at time zone 'utc' from authorizationcodes ac join clients cl on ac.clientid = cl.clientid join users us on ac.userid = us.userid left outer join scopes sc on ac.scopeid = sc.scopeid where ac.authorizationcode = vauthorizationcode;
procedure.code: CREATE FUNCTION getauthorizationcode(vauthorizationcode character varying) RETURNS TABLE("authorizationCode" character varying, "expiresAt" timestamp with time zone, scope uuid, redirecturi character varying, client uuid, "user" uuid, createdat timestamp with time zone) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ select ac.authorizationcode, ac.expires at time zone 'utc', sc.scopeuuid, ac.redirecturi, cl.clientuuid, us.useruuid, ac.createdat at time zone 'utc' from authorizationcodes ac join clients cl on ac.clientid = cl.clientid join users us on ac.userid = us.userid left outer join scopes sc on ac.scopeid = sc.scopeid where ac.authorizationcode = vauthorizationcode; $$;

procedure.name: public.getclient
procedure.routine_definition: select clientUUID, clientName, redirectUris, grants, scopeuuid::varchar from clients cl left outer join scopes sc on cl.scopeid = sc.scopeid where clientuuid = vClientUUID::uuid and clientsecret = (crypt(vClientSecret,clientsecret))
procedure.code: CREATE FUNCTION getclient(vclientuuid uuid, vclientsecret character varying) RETURNS TABLE(id uuid, clientname character varying, "redirectUris" text[], grants text[], scope character varying) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ select clientUUID, clientName, redirectUris, grants, scopeuuid::varchar from clients cl left outer join scopes sc on cl.scopeid = sc.scopeid where clientuuid = vClientUUID::uuid and clientsecret = (crypt(vClientSecret,clientsecret)) $$;

procedure.name: public.getclientbyid
procedure.routine_definition: select clientUUID, clientName, redirectUris, grants, scopeuuid::varchar from clients cl left outer join scopes sc on cl.scopeid = sc.scopeid where clientuuid = vClientUUID::uuid
procedure.code: CREATE FUNCTION getclientbyid(vclientuuid uuid) RETURNS TABLE(id uuid, clientname character varying, "redirectUris" text[], grants text[], scope character varying) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ select clientUUID, clientName, redirectUris, grants, scopeuuid::varchar from clients cl left outer join scopes sc on cl.scopeid = sc.scopeid where clientuuid = vClientUUID::uuid $$;

procedure.name: public.getrefreshtoken
procedure.routine_definition: select rt.refreshtoken, rt.expires at time zone 'utc', sc.scopeuuid, cl.clientuuid, us.useruuid, rt.createdat at time zone 'utc' from refreshtokens rt join clients cl on rt.clientid = cl.clientid join users us on rt.userid = us.userid left outer join scopes sc on rt.scopeid = sc.scopeid where rt.refreshtoken = vrefreshtoken;
procedure.code: CREATE FUNCTION getrefreshtoken(vrefreshtoken character varying) RETURNS TABLE("refreshToken" character varying, "refreshTokenExpiresAt" timestamp with time zone, scope uuid, client uuid, "user" uuid, createdat timestamp with time zone) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ select rt.refreshtoken, rt.expires at time zone 'utc', sc.scopeuuid, cl.clientuuid, us.useruuid, rt.createdat at time zone 'utc' from refreshtokens rt join clients cl on rt.clientid = cl.clientid join users us on rt.userid = us.userid left outer join scopes sc on rt.scopeid = sc.scopeid where rt.refreshtoken = vrefreshtoken; $$;

procedure.name: public.getuser
procedure.routine_definition: SELECT useruuid, externalid, firstname, lastname, useremail, array_agg(rl.rolename)::text[], oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat at time zone 'utc', updatedat at time zone 'utc' from users us join usersroles ur on us.userid = ur.userid join roles rl on rl.roleid = ur.roleid where us.useremail = vuseremail and us.userpwd = (crypt(vUserPwd,us.userpwd)) group by useruuid, externalid, firstname, lastname, useremail, oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat, updatedat
procedure.code: CREATE FUNCTION getuser(vuseremail character varying, vuserpwd character varying) RETURNS TABLE(id uuid, externalid character varying, firstname character varying, lastname character varying, useremail character varying, roles text[], oauth2provider character varying, thumbnail bytea, imgpath character varying, createdat timestamp with time zone, updatedat timestamp with time zone) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ SELECT useruuid, externalid, firstname, lastname, useremail, array_agg(rl.rolename)::text[], oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat at time zone 'utc', updatedat at time zone 'utc' from users us join usersroles ur on us.userid = ur.userid join roles rl on rl.roleid = ur.roleid where us.useremail = vuseremail and us.userpwd = (crypt(vUserPwd,us.userpwd)) group by useruuid, externalid, firstname, lastname, useremail, oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat, updatedat $$;

procedure.name: public.getuserbyexternalid
procedure.routine_definition: SELECT useruuid, externalid, username, firstname, lastname, useremail, array_agg(rl.rolename)::text[], oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat at time zone 'utc', updatedat at time zone 'utc' from users us join usersroles ur on us.userid = ur.userid join roles rl on rl.roleid = ur.roleid where us.externalid = vExternalID and us.oauth2provider = vOauth2Provider group by useruuid, externalid, username, firstname, lastname, useremail, oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat, updatedat;
procedure.code:
CREATE FUNCTION getuserbyexternalid(vexternalid character varying, voauth2provider character varying) RETURNS TABLE(id uuid, externalid character varying, username character varying, firstname character varying, lastname character varying, useremail character varying, roles text[], oauth2provider character varying, thumbnail bytea, imgpath character varying, createdat timestamp with time zone, updatedat timestamp with time zone) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ SELECT useruuid, externalid, username, firstname, lastname, useremail, array_agg(rl.rolename)::text[], oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat at time zone 'utc', updatedat at time zone 'utc' from users us join usersroles ur on us.userid = ur.userid join roles rl on rl.roleid = ur.roleid where us.externalid = vExternalID and us.oauth2provider = vOauth2Provider group by useruuid, externalid, username, firstname, lastname, useremail, oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat, updatedat;
$$;

procedure.name: public.getuserbyid
procedure.routine_definition: SELECT useruuid, externalid, username, firstname, lastname, useremail, array_agg(rl.rolename)::text[], oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat at time zone 'utc', updatedat at time zone 'utc' FROM Users us join usersroles ur on us.userid = ur.userid join roles rl on rl.roleid = ur.roleid WHERE UserUUID = vUserUUID group by useruuid, externalid, username, firstname, lastname, useremail, oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat, updatedat;
procedure.code:
CREATE FUNCTION getuserbyid(vuseruuid uuid) RETURNS TABLE(id uuid, externalid character varying, username character varying, firstname character varying, lastname character varying, useremail character varying, roles text[], oauth2provider character varying, thumbnail bytea, imgpath character varying, createdat timestamp with time zone, updatedat timestamp with time zone) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ SELECT useruuid, externalid, username, firstname, lastname, useremail, array_agg(rl.rolename)::text[], oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat at time zone 'utc', updatedat at time zone 'utc' FROM Users us join usersroles ur on us.userid = ur.userid join roles rl on rl.roleid = ur.roleid WHERE UserUUID = vUserUUID group by useruuid, externalid, username, firstname, lastname, useremail, oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, createdat, updatedat;
$$;

procedure.name: public.getuserfromclient
procedure.routine_definition: SELECT useruuid, externalid, firstname, lastname, useremail, array_agg(rl.rolename)::text[], oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, us.createdat at time zone 'utc', us.updatedat at time zone 'utc' from users us join clients cl on cl.userid = us.userid join usersroles ur on us.userid = ur.userid join roles rl on rl.roleid = ur.roleid where cl.clientuuid = vClientUUID::uuid group by useruuid, externalid, firstname, lastname, useremail, oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, us.createdat, us.updatedat;
procedure.code:
CREATE FUNCTION getuserfromclient(vclientuuid character varying) RETURNS TABLE(id uuid, externalid character varying, firstname character varying, lastname character varying, useremail character varying, roles text[], oauth2provider character varying, thumbnail bytea, imgpath character varying, createdat timestamp with time zone, updatedat timestamp with time zone) LANGUAGE sql AS $$ SELECT useruuid, externalid, firstname, lastname, useremail, array_agg(rl.rolename)::text[], oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, us.createdat at time zone 'utc', us.updatedat at time zone 'utc' from users us join clients cl on cl.userid = us.userid join usersroles ur on us.userid = ur.userid join roles rl on rl.roleid = ur.roleid where cl.clientuuid = vClientUUID::uuid group by useruuid, externalid, firstname, lastname, useremail, oauth2provider, thumbnail, imgpath, us.createdat, us.updatedat;
$$;
